A careless admin leaked half their RSA private key digits online. Can you recover the message from 6552547111062768347566629984978306240476848732618495464887550589990119218163750502779862553119414192549280844597612014424560686727168540234563274588501068 using this partial key exposure?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=7922381683620881969038167099948794837759778636561777642107969209180383616596709394626752219367695826327499176401288255204263452302814399620942590093171429, e=6747572045440054870617803820941606622043769349537889993489466333835734550577522726460862126870497106840429944432799268058576862794378899611637744389792041, partial_p=12652206785243964847

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{d0tof063}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 6552547111062768347566629984978306240476848732618495464887550589990119218163750502779862553119414192549280844597612014424560686727168540234563274588501068
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7922381683620881969038167099948794837759778636561777642107969209180383616596709394626752219367695826327499176401288255204263452302814399620942590093171429, e=6747572045440054870617803820941606622043769349537889993489466333835734550577522726460862126870497106840429944432799268058576862794378899611637744389792041, partial_p=12652206785243964847
extra_info: p=79419189168126029128391285245713176770567143680156178339883246563883724822531, q=99753998581496951547212446030305315099001120257558761418094624695908289319159, Ï†(n)=7922381683620881969038167099948794837759778636561777642107969209180383616596530221439002596387020222596223157909418686940325737363056421749682798079029740
